namelist_definition.entry: MOSART coupling period (sec). Default: 10800 Can ONLY be set by modifying the value of the xml variable ROF_NCPL in env_run.xml.
MOSART time step (sec). Default: 3600 Internal mosart timestep, will be adjusted down to be integer multiple of coupling_period if necessary
MOSART routing method. Default: 1 Routing Method, 1=KW, 4=DW
MOSART subtimestep count relative to delt_mosart Default: 5 Internal mosart subtimestep, will be used to compute
MOSART subtimestep count relative to delt_mosart Default: 3 Internal mosart subtimestep, will be used to compute
Default: .true. If .true., river runoff will be split up into liquid and ice streams, otherwise ice runoff will be zero and all runoff directed to liquid stream.
If ACTIVE, turn on rtm river routing Default: ACTIVE If the value rtm_mode is NULL, then rof_present will be set to false at runtime
Default: .false. If .true., water management model will be turned on.
Default: .false. If .true., inundation model will be turned on.
Default: .false. If .true., sediment model will be turned on.
Default: .false. If .true., heat model will be turned on.
Default: .false. If .true., reservoir stratification module will be turned on.
Default: 283.15 Initial reservoir temp taken above zero to avoid negative values at start.
Default: 50 Reservoir depth layers to calculate depth-area-storage relationship.
Default: 30 Maximum number of reservoir layers for stratification.

If .true., turn on mosart river routing Default: .true. If the value of the xml variable ROF GRID in env_build.xml is set to 'null', then the MOSART build-namelist will set do_mosart to .false. If do_mosart is set to .false., then MOSART will send a flag of rof_prognostic = .false. back to the coupler on initialization.
If .true., turn on mosart flooding back to clm Default: .false. Note that mosart flood is not supported in CESM1.1
If .true., turn on barriers around some timers Default: .false.
Decomposition Option for mosart Default: 'basin'
sparse matrix multiply Option for mosart Default: 'opt'
Full pathname of initial mosart file Default: ' '
Full pathname of master restart file for a branch run. (only used if RUN_TYPE=branch) (Set with xml variables RUN_REFCASE and RUN_REFDATE in env_run.xml)
Full pathname of input datafile for MOSART.
Fields to exclude from history tape series 1. Default: ' '
Fields to exclude from history tape series 2. Default: ' '
Fields to exclude from history tape series 3. Default: ' '
Fields to add to history tape series 1. Default: ' '
Fields to add to history tape series 2. Default: ' '
Fields to add to history tape series 3. Default: ' '
Per tape series maximum number of time samples. Default: 1,30,30
Per tape series history file density (i.e. output precision) 1=double precision 2=single precision Default: 2,2,2
Per tape series history write frequency. positive means in time steps 0=monthly negative means hours (i.e. 24 means every 24 time-steps and -24 means every day Default: 0,-24,-24
WRM input file
WRM water demand dataset
Extraction Flag, 0 = false
Extraction Main Channel Flag, 0 = false
Regulation Flag, 0 = false
Return Flow Flag, 0 = false
Total Demand Flag, 0 = false
Ground Water Flag, 0 = false
External Demand Flag, 0 = false
Demand variable from external file
Dam construction, 0 = false
Options for inundation scheme, 0=off, 1=on Default: 2

Options for diffusion wave channel routing method, 1 -- True diffusion wave method for channel routing, 2 -- False diffusion wave method: use riverbed slope as the surrogate for water surface slope Default: 2
Options to calculate channel Manning roughness coefficients, 1 -- use channel depth, 2 -- use channel depth and exponent of 1/3, 3 -- use channel width, 4 -- use one uniform value Default: 1
Max Manning coefficient for channels (when OPT_calcNr = 1, 2, 3) ( s*m^(-1/3) ) Default: 0.05
Min Manning coefficient for channels (when OPT_calcNr = 1, 2, 3) ( s*m^(-1/3) ) Default: 0.03
The uniform Manning coefficient for all channels (when OPT_calcNr = 4) ( s*m^(-1/3) ) Default: 0.04
Max channel depth (used when OPT_calcNr = 1, 2) (m) Default: 50.0
Min channel depth (used when OPT_calcNr = 1, 2) (m) Default: 1.0
Max channel width (used when OPT_calcNr = 3) (m) Default: 5000.0
Min channel width (used when OPT_calcNr = 3) (m) Default: 20.0
Use this assumed riverbed slope when the input riverbed slope <= zero (dimensionless) Default: 0.00001
Min tributary channel length for using tributary routing (m) Default: 10.0
Options of elevation profile data: 1 -- Use real data; 2 -- Use hypothetical values Default: 2
Number of dividing points in the elevation profile Default: 12
Threshold of the ratio of the lowest section's slope to the second lowest section's slope Default: 10.0
